title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Zhang Yiming stepped down as the founder of TikTok's parent company. What's it called?

A. ByteDance

B. Alibaba

C. Tencent

D. Baidu

---

2. Democrat India Walton, a socialist, was apparently defeated even though she was the only candidate on the mayoral ballot -- in what city?

A. Baltimore

B. Berkeley

C. Boise

D. Buffalo

---

3. Per a new book, "The End of Craving," what proportion of the calories consumed by American kids comes from highly processed foods?

A. A quarter

B. Half

C. Two thirds

D. Three quarters

---

4. Jacob Herzog hopes to become the chief rabbi -- of which unlikely country?

A. Myanmar

B. Iceland

C. North Korea

D. Saudi Arabia

---

5. Research suggests that restaurant "atmospherics" influence behavior. How do diners respond to dim lights?

A. They fall asleep.

B. They order more fattening food.

C. They tend to split an entree.

D. They leave bigger tips.

---

6. Maine is killing some moose to save the rest from death by a thousand -- what?

A. Subdivisions

B. SUVs

C. Ticks

D. All of the above

---

7. Verizon and AT&T agreed to postpone their Dec. 5 rollout of 5G service by a month. Why?

A. A desire to tighten security on planned 5G networks

B. The need to reprogram millions of telephone SIM cards

C. Concerns about aircraft safety

D. A global shortage of Gs

---

8. Africa is having "an epidemic of coup d'etats." Which country had the latest?

A. Sudan

B. Kenya

C. Ethiopia

D. Rwanda

---

9. The Atlanta Braves beat the Houston Astros to win the World Series, getting six shutout innings in the final game -- from which starting pitcher?

A. Max Scherzer

B. Max Fried

C. Max Kepler

D. Max Bialystock

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. D

3. C

4. D

5. B

6. C

7. C

8. A

9. B
